ygData.subject: Re: Serpentor VS Lunaprine
ygData.msgSnippet: Lunarpine watched with a satisfaction inside himself. He aproached Serpentor prepared to finish his revenge. He swerved avoiding the optic blast when He heard

Lunarpine watched with a satisfaction inside himself. He aproached Serpentor
prepared to finish his revenge. He swerved avoiding the optic blast when He
heard a missle aproaching from behind and leapt over Serpentor to place him
between The missle and the wolf. The missle moved to avoid Serpentor and
continued to pursue Lunarpine. He worked himself around the missle but again
the missle turned back towards him. Lunarpine decided to take a more direct
aproach. He leapt directly above the missle slashing down the side hoping to
redirect it away from him into the ground. He wasn't surgically precise and
the missle exploded sending the halfbreed through the air. He was hurt bad
as dirt and his mech fluid combined on the ground. He rolled over to try to
find Serpentor but had lost sight of him. He stayed low anw watched for any
sign of a threat as his repair system worked on his lesser injuries.
----- Original Message -----
From: <KSLawdogg@...>
To: <nbwrpg@egroups.com>
Sent: Sunday, December 24, 2000 2:20 PM
Subject: Serpentor VS Lunaprine


> (Also forgot to mention Vehement and his goons arrived and Vehement opened
> fine on you, but that's ok.  Just thought I'd change the subject since it
> ain't OOC anymore)
>
>
> Serpentor/Vehement:
>
>
>
> Serpentor raised his plasma launcher to point at Lunaprine's head as he
> transformed into his half-wolf mode.  Serpentor dropped his plasma
launcher
> and fell to his knees, his right hand covering where his right audio
receptor
> would be, his left hand trying to do the same.  Serpentor started yelling
out
> in pain, clenching his optics for a second to try and think clearly.  He
> opened them back up, firing an optic blast off at the wolfbot in front of
him.
>
> ---
>
> Vehement silently walked along the burnt grass of South Africa, looking
and
> smiling at the carnage.  He raised his left arm, the hand at the end of
the
> arm changing into a long silver barrel.  He raised the barrel to point at
> Lunaprine's back.
>
> A missile launched off from the barrel out at Lunaprine's back, the
missile
> an energy-signature seeking missile.  Vehement smiled, looking for a new
> target.  He didn't really want to choose just one.  But, since he was
allied
> with the Alliance, it wouldn't be nice to let one of their ranks die at
the
> hands of infidels.  Of course, they were all heathens and would die
> eventually, but the Divine One wasn't back in this realm.  Vehement's
optics
> sensors glowed a bright crimson as he watched a missile launch out from
the
> CF and strike him in the chest.
>
> He didn't make a sound, his body shaking for a moment.  He stood his
ground
> though.  He looked down to his chest as if barely intersted.  An
expression
> of rage reached his face as he saw his ceremonial robes were burnt and
> ruined.  He raised his right arm, which changed into the shape of a long
> silver barrel, two missiles launching out at the Cybertronian Fire as if
in
> retaliation.
>
>
>
>
